intro: Pterisanthes dalhousiae var. minor, commonly known as the lesser flameleaf, is a rare and ornamental plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Acanthaceae family and is characterized by its striking, flame-like orange-red foliage. The plant produces small, tubular flowers that are typically pink or purple, arranged in spikes. It thrives in well-drained soil and prefers full sun to partial shade. Due to its rarity and unique appearance, it is often cultivated in specialized gardens and botanical collections.
